page.title: 14Landmarks - The Holestone
page.content: On a rocky height in the townland of {Holestone }stands a large stone which is a pagan monument.It is nearly 2 metres in height and 3 metres in circumference.About one metre from the ground is a hole large enough to accomadate a hand. This is thought to be a pagan{trysting }place and such a place is deemed to be consecrated as a place where the marraige ceremony could take place. The couple are thought to have clasped hands through the stone and so solemnised their {marriage. In more modern times the place is a favourite haunt of courting couples.We like to think they feel the atmosphere from the days long ago and the old {religion.
